description:
This module introduces theories, methods and
important debates in the sociology of religion to
students interested in understanding religion in society
and the social dimensions of religious beliefs and
practices. Students will be able to analyse the social
origins and organisation of religion, as well as
understand trends such as secularisation and the
resurgence of religion. The module will also focus on
transnational issues related to religion in Asia.
title: Sociology of Religion
